info.title: API Reference
info.description:
Bittrex provides a simple and powerful REST API to allow you to programatically perform nearly all actions you can from our web interface. All requests use the `application/json` content type and go over `https`. The base url is `https://bittrex.com/api/{version}/`. All requests are GET requests and all responses come in a default response object with the result in the result field. Always check the `success` flag to ensure that your API call succeeded.

We are currently restricting orders to 500 open orders and 200,000 orders a day. We reserve the right to change these settings as we tune the system. If you are affected by these limits as an active trader, please visit [https://support.bittrex.com](https://support.bittrex.com) and open a support ticket.

If you have any questions, feedback or recommendations for API support you can post a question in our support center.

api_key.description:
In the spirit of keeping things simple, we offer an easy to manage API Key authentication method. You can have multiple API keys, each with their own level of rights. To manage your API keys please go to _Settings > Manage API Keys_.
> __Note__: You MUST have 2FA enabled to create an API key for your own safety.

- __Read Info__ - You can only view the balances, orders, and other details of the account
- __Withdraw__ - We allow you to programatically withdraw any currency to an address you provide. This can be used to quick arbitrage exchanges or move money into cold storage after thresholds.
- __Trade Limit__ - This allows the API key to place LIMIT buy and sell orders

For this version, we use a standard HMAC-SHA512 signing. Append `apikey` and `nonce` to your request and calculate the HMAC hash and include it under an apisign header.

 __Note:__ the nonce is not respected right now but will be enforced later.
api_key.name: apikey

API Reference.description:
Our APIs are broken into three distinct groups:

- **Public**- Public information available without an API key
- **Market**- For programmatic trading of cryptocurrencies
- **Account**- For managing your account

get.description: Used to get the open and available trading markets at Bittrex along with other meta data
Used to get all supported currencies at Bittrex along with other meta data.
Used to get the current tick values for a market.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: a string literal for the market (ex: BTC-LTC)

get.description: Used to get the last 24 hour summary of all active markets.
Used to get the last 24 hour summary of a specific market.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: a string literal for the market (ex: BTC-LTC)

get.description: Used to get retrieve the orderbook for a given market.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: a string literal for the market (ex: BTC-LTC)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: `buy`, `sell` or `both` to identify the type of orderbook to return

get.description: Used to retrieve the latest trades that have occurred for a specific market.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: a string literal for the market (ex: BTC-LTC)

get.description: Used to place a buy order in a specific market. Use buylimit to place limit orders. Make sure you have the proper permissions set on your API keys for this call to work.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: a string literal for the market (ex: BTC-LTC)

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: the amount to purchase

parameters.name: rate
parameters.description: the rate at which to place the order

get.description: Used to place an sell order in a specific market. Use selllimit to place limit orders. Make sure you have the proper permissions set on your API keys for this call to work.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: a string literal for the market (ex: BTC-LTC)

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: the amount to purchase

parameters.name: rate
parameters.description: the rate at which to place the order

get.description: Used to cancel a buy or sell order.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: uuid of buy or sell order

get.description: Get all orders that you currently have opened. A specific market can be requested.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: a string literal for the market (ie. BTC-LTC)

get.description: Used to retrieve all balances from your account.
Used to retrieve the balance from your account for a specific currency.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: a string literal for the currency (ie. BTC)

get.description: Used to retrieve or generate an address for a specific currency. If one does not exist, the call will fail and return ADDRESS_GENERATING until one is available.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: a string literal for the currency (ie. BTC)

get.description: Used to withdraw funds from your account. _Note: please account for txfee._

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: a string literal for the currency (ie. BTC)

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: the quantity of coins to withdraw

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: the address where to send the funds

parameters.name: paymentid
parameters.description: used for CryptoNotes/BitShareX/Nxt/XRP and any other coin that has a memo/message/tag/paymentid option

get.description: Used to retrieve a single order by uuid

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: the uuid of the buy or sell order

get.description: Used to retrieve your order history.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: a string literal for the market (ie. BTC-LTC). If omitted, will return for all markets

get.description: Used to retrieve your withdrawal history.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: a string literal for the currency (ie. BTC). If omitted, will return for all currencies

get.description: Used to retrieve your deposit history.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: a string literal for the currency (ie. BTC). If omitted, will return for all currencies
